Bangalore District Court

State By Kalasipalya P.S vs 2 on 5 September, 2018

 IN THE COURT OF THE VIII ADDL. C.M.M.,
 BENGALURU.

 Dated this the 5th day of September 2018.

 Present: Sri.M.Mahesh Babu, B.A., LL.B.  
    VIII ADDL.C.M.M., BENGALURU.

 C.C. NO.17620/2008

 JUDGMENT U/S 355 OF THE 
Cr.P.C
. 1973.

1. Sl. No. of the Case  17620/2008

2. The date  of commission  02/04/2007
 of the offence

3. Name of the complainant State by Kalasipalya P.
S. 

4
. Name of the accused 1. Syed Abubkar Siddiq
 (split up)

 2. Farahath John w/o Syed 
 Ameer John, aged 57 years

 3. Umar Farooq s/o Syed 
 Ameer John, aged 30 years

 4. Maimunnisa (dead)

 5. Ayisha w/o Aboojar
 aged about 28 years

 6. Ruksana w/o Alla Baksh 
 aged about 32 years
 2 C.C.17620/2008

 7. Fairoz Khan s/o Alla Baksh
 aged about 32 years

 8. Akram Pasha s/o late 
 Abdul Jabbar, aged 42 years

 9. Pouzia w/o Akram Pasha 
 aged about 30 years

 all are r/at No.10/1 & 15/1, 
 5th Cross, LBF Road, 
 Doddamavally, Bangalore
5. The offence complained of U/s. 498(A), 324 of 
IPC
 and 3 
 or proved and 4 
DP Act

6. Plea of the accused and  Pleaded not guilty
 his examination
7. Final Order Acting U/
sec.248(1)
  Cr.P.C.
 accused 2, 3, 5 to 9 are 
 acquitted.

8. Date of such order 05­09­2018
 For the following:­

 JUDGMENT

                  This   is   the  charge sheet filed by  the  PSI   of

 Kalasipalya P.S. against the accused 2, 3, 5 to 9 for the

 offences punishable U/sec. 498(A), 324 of 
IPC
 and 3 &

 4 
D.P. Act
.

 2. The brief facts of the prosecution case is that:

 3 C.C.17620/2008

 That the accused 1 married Cw1 on 08­01­2004

at   Dodda   Mavlli   Maszid   in   accordance   with   Muslim

customs   and   the   accused   1   to   9   treated   Cw1   with

cruelty both physically and mentally and assaulted her

with hands on the body in demand of additioal dowry

of   Rs.2,00,000/­   and   thrown   out   her   along   with   her

child from matrimonial house and thereby  committed

the alleged offences.  

3. Accused 1 split up, accused 2, 3, 5 to 9 were in

bail.   Substance   of   accusation   was   read   over   to   the

accused   2,   3,   5   to   9   for   the   offence   punishable

U/
sec.498A
,   
324
   of   IPC,   and   3   &   4   
D.P.   Act
.     The

accused   2,   3,   5   to   9   have   pleaded   not   guilty   and

claimed to be tried.     

4. In   order   to   substantiate   the   allegation,

prosecution   has   examined  PW.1   and  got   marked  the

documents as Ex.P1 to P4. Accused 1 and 2 have been

questioned u/sec. 313 of Cr.PC.  

 4 C.C.17620/2008

5. Heard arguments from both the sides. 

6.   The   points   that   arise   for   determination   are   as

follows: 

 1. Whether the prosecution proves beyond all

 reasonable doubt that the accused 1 married

 Cw1 on 08­01­2004 at Dodda Mavalli Maszid

 in accordance with Muslim customs and the

 accused 1 to 9 treated Cw1 with cruelty both

 physically   and   mentally   and   assaulted   her

 with hands on the body of Cw1 in demand of

 additional dowry of Rs.2,00,000/­ and thrown

 out   Cw1   along   with   her   child   from

 matrimonial house and thereby committed the

 offences punishable
 u/s 498A
, 
324
 of IPC and

 3 & 4 
DP Act
?

 2. What order?

7.  The answer to the above points are as follows:

 Point No.1: In the negative
 Point No.2: As per final order for the following: 

 5 C.C.17620/2008

 R E A S O N S

8.    Point   No.1:­  In   order   to  bring   home   the   guilt   of

accused,   the   prosecution   has   examined   PW.1.     PW1

who is the IO who has deposed that he has registered

the   crime   and   sent   FIR   to   the   court   and   for   further

investigation handed over case file to CW13.

9. It is paramount fact to note that in the present

case on hand even after issuance of summons warrant

and proclamation to CW2, 3, 5 to 9. The prosecution

has failed to secure the presence of CW2, 3, 5 to 9. As

such by rejecting the prayer of Sr.APP the CW2, 3, 5 to

9   have   been   dropped   as   not   secured.   Since,   the

prosecution   has   not   examined   material   witness   i.e.,

complaint   and   mahazar   and   other   independent

witness.   Under   those   circumstances   the   prosecution

case falls short and based on the sole evidence of PW1

who has registered the crime, the guilty of the accused

cannot be proved. As such, the prosecution has failed

 6 C.C.17620/2008

to   prove   the   guilty   of   the   accused   CW2,   3,   5   to   9

beyond   all   reasonable   doubt.     Accordingly,   I   answer

point no.1 in the negative.

10.  Point No.2:­  In the result, I proceed to pass the

following:

 ORDER

 Acting under 
Section 248 (1)
 of Cr.P.C., accused

CW2,   3,   5   to   9   are   hereby   acquitted   of   the   offences

punishable U/sec. 498A, 324 of 
IPC
 and 3 & 4 D.P.Act.

 Bail   bonds   of   accused   CW2,   3,   5   to   9   and   their

surety bond stands cancelled. 

(Dictated to the stenographer directly on the computer, verified and corrected by me, then the
judgment pronounced by me in the open court, on this 5 th day of September 2018.)

  (M. Mahesh Babu)
                 VIII Addl.C.M.M. Bengaluru.

 7 C.C.17620/2008

 : Annexure :

1.   List   of   Witnesses   examined   on   behalf   of   the
prosecution: 

PW1 : Manojkumar

2.   List   of   Documents   marked   on   behalf   of   the
prosecution:­ 

Ex.P1 : Complaint
Ex.P1(a) : Signature of PW1
Ex.P2 : FIR
Ex.P2(a) : Signature of PW1

3. List of Material objects marked on behalf of the
prosecution:­   

­ NIL ­

4.   List   of   witnesses   and   documents   marked   on
behalf of the accused: 

­NIL ­  

 VIII Addl. C. M. M.  Bangalore.

 8 C.C.17620/2008

 Judgment pronounced in the open court
 (vide separate order)

 ORDER

 Acting under 
Section 248 (1)
 of Cr.P.C., accused

CW2,   3,   5   to   9   are   hereby   acquitted   of   the   offences

punishable U/sec. 498A, 324 of 
IPC
 and 3 & 4 D.P.Act.

 Bail bonds of accused CW2, 3, 5 to 9 and their

surety bond stands cancelled.

 VIII Addl. C. M. M.  Bangalore.

JUDGMENT
This   is   the  charge sheet filed by  the  PSI   of
Kalasipalya P.S. against the accused 2, 3, 5 to 9 for the

offences punishable U/sec. 498(A), 324 of 
IPC
 and 3 &

4 
D.P. Act
.
2. The brief facts of the prosecution case is that:
That the accused 1 married Cw1 on 08­01­2004
at   Dodda   Mavlli   Maszid   in   accordance   with   Muslim
customs   and   the   accused   1   to   9   treated   Cw1   with
cruelty both physically and mentally and assaulted her
with hands on the body in demand of additioal dowry
of   Rs.2,00,000/­   and   thrown   out   her   along   with   her
child from matrimonial house and thereby  committed
the alleged offences.
3. Accused 1 split up, accused 2, 3, 5 to 9 were in
bail.   Substance   of   accusation   was   read   over   to   the
accused   2,   3,   5   to   9   for   the   offence   punishable

U/
sec.498A
,   
324
   of   IPC,   and   3   &   4   
D.P.   Act
.     The
accused   2,   3,   5   to   9   have   pleaded   not   guilty   and
claimed to be tried.
4. In   order   to   substantiate   the   allegation,
prosecution   has   examined  PW.1   and  got   marked  the
documents as Ex.P1 to P4. Accused 1 and 2 have been
questioned u/sec. 313 of Cr.PC.
5. Heard arguments from both the sides.
6.   The   points   that   arise   for   determination   are   as
follows:
1. Whether the prosecution proves beyond all
reasonable doubt that the accused 1 married
Cw1 on 08­01­2004 at Dodda Mavalli Maszid
in accordance with Muslim customs and the
accused 1 to 9 treated Cw1 with cruelty both
physically   and   mentally   and   assaulted   her
with hands on the body of Cw1 in demand of
additional dowry of Rs.2,00,000/­ and thrown
out   Cw1   along   with   her   child   from
matrimonial house and thereby committed the

offences punishable
 u/s 498A
, 
324
 of IPC and

3 & 4 
DP Act
?
2. What order?
7.  The answer to the above points are as follows:

Point No.1: In the negative
 Point No.2: As per final order for the following:
R E A S O N S
8.    Point   No.1:­  In   order   to  bring   home   the   guilt   of
accused,   the   prosecution   has   examined   PW.1.     PW1
who is the IO who has deposed that he has registered
the   crime   and   sent   FIR   to   the   court   and   for   further
investigation handed over case file to CW13.
9. It is paramount fact to note that in the present
case on hand even after issuance of summons warrant
and proclamation to CW2, 3, 5 to 9. The prosecution
has failed to secure the presence of CW2, 3, 5 to 9. As
such by rejecting the prayer of Sr.APP the CW2, 3, 5 to
9   have   been   dropped   as   not   secured.   Since,   the
prosecution   has   not   examined   material   witness   i.e.,
complaint   and   mahazar   and   other   independent
witness.   Under   those   circumstances   the   prosecution
case falls short and based on the sole evidence of PW1
who has registered the crime, the guilty of the accused
cannot be proved. As such, the prosecution has failed
to   prove   the   guilty   of   the   accused   CW2,   3,   5   to   9
beyond   all   reasonable   doubt.     Accordingly,   I   answer
point no.1 in the negative.
10.  Point No.2:­  In the result, I proceed to pass the
following:
ORDER

Acting under 
Section 248 (1)
 of Cr.P.C., accused
CW2,   3,   5   to   9   are   hereby   acquitted   of   the   offences

punishable U/sec. 498A, 324 of 
IPC
 and 3 & 4 D.P.Act.
Bail   bonds   of   accused   CW2,   3,   5   to   9   and   their
surety bond stands cancelled.

(Dictated to the stenographer directly on the computer, verified and corrected by me, then the
judgment pronounced by me in the open court, on this 5 th day of September 2018.)

(M. Mahesh Babu)
